citation.article-title: Streptococcus ovis sp. nov., isolated from sheep
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptococcus ovis sp. nov.
Streptococcus ovis (o'vis. L. gen. n. ovis of the sheep)
Cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming cocci that occur singly, in pairs or in short chains.
Colonies are of.5-1.0 mm diameter after 24 h and are α-haemolytic on sheep and horse blood.
Facultatively anaerobic and catalase- and oxidase-negative.
Using commercial API systems, strains produce acid from glucose, glycogen, lactose, maltose, mannitol, raffinose, trehalose, sorbitol and sucrose.
Most strains produce acid from dtagatose but most fail to ferment cyclodextrin.
Acid is not produced from D-arabitol, L-arabinose, melibiose, melezitose, methyl β-D-glucopyranoside, pullulan or ribose.
Alanyl-phenylalanine-proline arylamidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, esterase C-4 (weak reaction), leucine arylamidase and phosphoamidase (weak reaction) activities are detected.

No activity is detected for alkaline phosphatase, chymotrypsin, ester lipase C8, lipase C14, α-fucosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase, β-mannosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, trypsin or urease.
Variable reactions are obtained for acid phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase, α-galactosidase, cystine arylamidase, valine arylamidase and glycyl-tryptophan arylamidase.
Hippurate hydrolysis and Voges-Proskauer tests are negative.
The G­C content of DNA is 38 mol%.
Isolated from clinical specimens from sheep.
